2802.definition: [Κλαύδη] of uncertain derivation; Claude, an island near Crete

2803.definition: [Κλαυδία] feminine of {{G2804}}; Claudia, a Christian woman

2804.definition: [Κλαύδιος] of Latin origin; Claudius, the name of two Romans

2806.definition: [κλάω] a primary verb; to break (specially, of bread)

2807.definition: [κλείς] from {{G2808}}; a key (as shutting a lock), literally or figuratively

2808.definition: [κλείω] a primary verb; to close (literally or figuratively)

2809.definition: [κλέμμα] from {{G2813}}; stealing (properly, the thing stolen, but used of the act)

2810.definition: [Κλεόπας] probably contracted from Κλεόπατρος (compound of {{G2811}} and {{G3962}}); Cleopas, a Christian

2811.definition: [κλέος] from a shorter form of {{G2564}}; renown (as if being called)

2812.definition: [κλέπτης] from {{G2813}}; a stealer (literally or figuratively) Compare {{G3027}}.

2814.definition: [κλῆμα] from {{G2806}}; a limb or shoot (as if broken off)

2815.definition: [Κλήμης] of Latin origin; merciful; Clemes (i.e. Clemens), a Christian

2816.definition: [κληρονομέω] from {{G2818}}; to be an heir to (literally or figuratively)

2817.definition: [κληρονομία] from {{G2818}}; heirship, i.e. (concretely) a patrimony or (genitive case) a possession

2818.definition: [κληρονόμος] from {{G2819}} and the base of {{G3551}} (in its original sense of partitioning, i.e. (reflexively) getting by apportionment); a sharer by lot, i.e. inheritor (literally or figuratively); by implication, a possessor

2819.definition: [κλῆρος] probably from {{G2806}} (through the idea of using bits of wood, etc., for the purpose; a die (for drawing chances); by implication, a portion (as if so secured); by extension, an acquisition (especially a patrimony, figuratively)

2820.definition: [κληρόω] from {{G2819}}; to allot, i.e. (figuratively) to assign (a privilege)

2821.definition: [κλῆσις] from a shorter form of {{G2564}}; an invitation (figuratively)

2822.definition: [κλητός] from the same as {{G2821}}; invited, i.e. appointed, or (specially), a saint

2823.definition: [κλίβανος] of uncertain derivation; an earthen pot used for baking in

2824.definition: [κλίμα] from {{G2827}}; a slope, i.e. (specially) a "clime" or tract of country

2825.definition: [κλίνη] from {{G2827}}; a couch (for sleep, sickness, sitting or eating)

2826.definition: [κλινίδιον] neuter of a presumed derivative of {{G2825}}; a pallet or little couch

2827.definition: [κλίνω] a primary verb; to slant or slope, i.e. incline or recline (literally or figuratively)

2828.definition: [κλισία] from a derivative of {{G2827}}; properly, reclination, i.e. (concretely and specially), a party at a meal

2830.definition: [κλύδων] from κλύζω (to billow or dash over); a surge of the sea (literally or figuratively)

2831.definition: [κλυδωνίζομαι] middle voice from {{G2830}}; to surge, i.e. (figuratively) to fluctuate

2832.definition: [Κλωπᾶς] of Chaldee origin (corresponding to {{H256}}); Clopas, an Israelite

2833.definition: [κνήθω] from a primary κνάω (to scrape); to scratch, i.e. (by implication) to tickle

2834.definition: [Κνίδος] probably of foreign origin; Cnidus, a place in Asia Minor

2835.definition: [κοδράντης] of Latin origin; a quadrans, i.e. the fourth part of an as

2836.definition: [κοιλία] from κοῖλος ("hollow"); a cavity, i.e. (especially) the abdomen; by implication, the matrix; figuratively, the heart

2837.definition: [κοιμάω] from {{G2749}}; to put to sleep, i.e. (passively or reflexively) to slumber; figuratively, to decease

2839.definition: [κοινός] probably from {{G4862}}; common, i.e. (literally) shared by all or several, or (ceremonially) profane

2841.definition: [κοινωνέω] from {{G2844}}; to share with others (objectively or subjectively)

2842.definition: [κοινωνία] from {{G2844}}; partnership, i.e. (literally) participation, or (social) intercourse, or (pecuniary) benefaction

2845.definition: [κοίτη] from {{G2749}}; a couch; by extension, cohabitation; by implication, the male sperm

2847.definition: [κόκκινος] from {{G2848}} (from the kernel-shape of the insect); crimson-colored

2848.definition: [κόκκος] apparently a primary word; a kernel of seed

2849.definition: [κολάζω] from κόλος (dwarf); properly, to curtail, i.e. (figuratively) to chastise (or reserve for infliction)

2850.definition: [κολακεία] from a derivative of κόλαξ (a fawner); flattery

2852.definition: [κολαφίζω] from a derivative of the base of {{G2849}}; to rap with the fist

2853.definition: [κολλάω] from κόλλα ("glue"); to glue, i.e. (passively or reflexively) to stick (figuratively)

2854.definition: [κολλούριον] neuter of a presumed derivative of κολλύρα (a cake; prob akin to the base of {{G2853}}); properly, a poultice (as made of or in the form of crackers), i.e. (by analogy) a plaster

2855.definition: [κολλυβιστής] from a presumed derivative of κόλλυβος (a small coin; probably akin to {{G2854}}); a coin-dealer

2856.definition: [κολοβόω] from a derivative of the base of {{G2849}}; to dock, i.e. (figuratively) abridge

2857.definition: [Κολοσσαί] apparently feminine plural of kolossos ("colossal"); Colossæ, a place in Asia Minor

2858.definition: [Κολοσσαεύς] from {{G2857}}; a Colossæan, (i.e. inhabitant of Colossæ

2859.definition: [κόλπος] apparently a primary word; the bosom; by analogy, a bay

2860.definition: [κολυμβάω] from κόλυμβος (a diver); to plunge into water

2861.definition: [κολυμβήθρα] from {{G2860}}; a diving-place, i.e. pond for bathing (or swimming)

2862.definition: [κολωνία] of Latin origin; a Roman "colony" for veterans

2863.definition: [κομάω] from {{G2864}}; to wear tresses of hair

2864.definition: [κόμη] apparently from the same as {{G2865}}; the hair of the head (locks, as ornamental, and thus differing from {{G2359}}; which properly denotes merely the scalp)

2865.definition: [κομίζω] from a primary κομέω (to tend, i.e. take care of); properly, to provide for, i.e. (by implication) to carry off (as if from harm; genitive case obtain)

2866.definition: [κομψότερον] neuter comparative of a derivative of the base of 2865 (meaning, properly, well dressed, i.e. nice); figuratively, convalescent

2867.definition: [κονιάω] from κονία (dust; by analogy, lime); to whitewash

2868.definition: [κονιορτός] from the base of {{G2867}} and ornumi (to "rouse"); pulverulence (as blown about)

2869.definition: [κοπάζω] from {{G2873}}; to tire, i.e. (figuratively) to relax

2870.definition: [κοπετός] from {{G2875}}; mourning (properly, by beating the breast)

2872.definition: [κοπιάω] from a derivative of {{G2873}}; to feel fatigue; by implication, to work hard

2873.definition: [κόπος] from {{G2875}}; a cut, i.e. (by analogy) toil (as reducing the strength), literally or figuratively; by implication, pains

2874.definition: [κοπρία] from κόπρος (ordure; perhaps akin to {{G2875}}); manure

2875.definition: [κόπτω] a primary verb; to "chop"; specially, to beat the breast in grief Compare the base of {{G5114}}.

2876.definition: [κόραξ] perhaps from {{G2880}}; a crow (from its voracity)

2877.definition: [κοράσιον] neuter of a presumed derivative of κόρη (a maiden); a (little) girl

2878.definition: [κορβᾶν]   and κορβανᾶςof Hebrew and Chaldee origin respectively ({{H7133}}); a votive offering and the offering; a consecrated present (to the Temple fund); by extension (the latter term) the Treasury itself, i.e. the room where the contribution boxes stood

2879.definition: [Κορέ] of Hebrew origin ({{H7141}}); Core (i.e. Korach), an Israelite

2880.definition: [κορέννυμι] a primary verb; to cram, i.e. glut or sate

2881.definition: [Κορίνθιος] from {{G2882}}; a Corinthian, i.e. inhabitant of Corinth

2882.definition: [Κόρινθος] of uncertain derivation; Corinthus, a city of Greece

2883.definition: [Κορνήλιος] of Latin origin; Cornelius, a Roman

2884.definition: [κόρος] of Hebrew origin ({{H3734}}); a cor, i.e. a specific measure

2885.definition: [κοσμέω] from {{G2889}}; to put in proper order, i.e. decorate (literally or figuratively); specially, to snuff (a wick)

2886.definition: [κοσμικός] from {{G2889}} (in its secondary sense); terrene ("cosmic"), literally (mundane) or figuratively (corrupt)

2887.definition: [κόσμιος] from {{G2889}} (in its primary sense); orderly, i.e. decorous

2888.definition: [κοσμοκράτωρ] from {{G2889}} and {{G2902}}; a world-ruler, an epithet of Satan

2889.definition: [κόσμος] probably from the base of {{G2865}}; orderly arrangement, i.e. decoration; by implication, the world (in a wide or narrow sense, including its inhabitants, literally or figuratively (morally))

2890.definition: [Κούαρτος] of Latin origin (fourth); Quartus, a Christian

2892.definition: [κουστωδία] of Latin origin; "custody", i.e. a Roman sentry

2893.definition: [κουφίζω] from κοῦφος (light in weight); to unload

2895.definition: [κράββατος] probably of foreign origin; a mattress

2896.definition: [κράζω] a primary verb; properly, to "croak" (as a raven) or scream, i.e. (genitive case) to call aloud (shriek, exclaim, intreat)

2897.definition: [κραιπάλη] probably from the same as {{G726}}; properly, a headache (as a seizure of pain) from drunkenness, i.e. (by implication) a debauch (by analogy, a glut)

2898.definition: [κρανίον] diminutive of a derivative of the base of {{G2768}}; a skull ("cranium")

2899.definition: [κράσπεδον] of uncertain derivation; a margin, i.e. (specially), a fringe or tassel
